alert.note: Alert for Dimmit (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 8:05AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Dimmit County through 845 AM CDT... At 805 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Chupadera Ranch Airport, or 20 miles south of Carrizo Springs, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Dimmit County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central Texas.
